titleStmt.title: William Lacefield et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8943

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his excellency the governor of Ky. At the July term of the Anderson Circuit Court held in 1863, your petitioner Henry Gee was fined the sum of fifty dollars for the offense of selling liquor to a minor.

The circumstances are of such a mitigating nature that the following Jury who tried the case subscribes to this petition. On final hearing prays that your executive clemency may be extended towards him and that said fine be remitted. Your petitioner is a poor man.

Jury
William Lacefield
T Welim
Travis Brown
Saml Burge
J, Y, Perry
F, M, Miller
James McCall
Jackson Sierr
Thomas Pilcher
I C. H. Fenwick certify that the above were all the Jury who tried the case except one by consent ten tried it.
C. H. Fenwick C A C C

Anderson Cir. Ct
$50 2 cases } Liquor to a minor & Tipling
The fines in each of the within cases remitted except the sum of Ten dollars & costs in each case

J F Robinson
Henry Geo
Issd July 24 1863.
